page.title: 01Resume of the area
page.content: The area is rich agricultural land,forming part of the Vale of York.It is very flat except for some embankments for bridges over the main Newcastle_London railway.Most of the fields contain arable crops,particularly wheat potatoes and sugar beet though some is pasture.Apart from outlying farm houses the only centre of population is part of Raskelf containing less than 500 people.It is a twin settlement,with 'the Green' separate from the rest of Raskelf.In the Middle Ages the area was covered by the Forest of Galtres.Today there are still a few woods but they contain mainly recently planted conifers rather than the old oaks.In the south west corner is part of Tholthorpe airfield used in World War 2.
